intro: Ilysanthes monticola, commonly known as the mountain ilysanth, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a pale yellow to white coloration. Ilysanthes monticola plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for various invertebrates.
